info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 11:37AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Perry, Wayne, Jefferson, Williamson, Jackson, Franklin and western Hamilton Counties through 1230 PM CDT... At 1136 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Woodlawn to near Christopher to near Cedar Lake Area. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Christopher, Zeigler and Woodlawn around 1140 AM CDT. Sesser and Valier around 1145 AM CDT. Mount Vernon, Benton, Rend Lake Area, De Soto and West City around 1150 AM CDT. Hurst around 1155 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Carterville, Crainville, Cambria, Herrin, Energy, Bluford, Marion, West Frankfort and Johnston City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
